main event: A long red streak was observed traveling east toward Gander Air Force Base near Glenwood, Newfoundland around midnight on February 25, 1958.
interesting points: A civilian reported seeing a disc-like object fall from the sky and land, causing a clearing in the trees and snow.
The civilian could not relocate the alleged landing site during a subsequent ground search.
Radar operators at Gander Air Force Base observed an erratic object on their radar scope, but determined it was likely a bright star affected by atmospheric conditions.
Two local officials indicated the civilian who reported the sighting had a reputation for making questionable claims.
No photographs or physical evidence of the sighting were obtained.
sighted object: A long red streak, a disc-like object
witnesses: Civilian, radar operators at Gander Air Force Base
